TopicTitle: Planet Factory Revived for Kopernicus/KittopiaTech - Version 0.04

Articles.Content:
RELEASE THREAD

I've created PF planets for Kopernicus, but with some tweaks.

Some pics:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Some pictures of a mission to Etaria, a moon of the sub-brown dwarf Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis, which orbits Serious. The spacecraft also flew by Joker, Kerbolis, and Pingle:

Thanks!

Urania itself is possible, but actual terrain for moons can't currently be done without RealSolarSystem. Skelton and Joker right now have no new terrain and if you get close enough the new textures dissapear.

Good to see Planet Factory planets back in action!

Just a quick note--to comply with the Add-on Posting Rules your download zip will require a copy of the license.

Also, you're shipping configs for both Distant Objects and for PlanetShine without mentioning it, configs which (a) overwrite people's existing files, ( collide, and © will override people's existing settings. Please fix that.

I'm still not a huge fan of this system...

It just seems to present far too many extreme planets and moons

It's meant to be an L0-class main sequence star.

Edited December 7, 2014 by _Augustus_

It's meant to be an M6-class star. M7-M9 stars are even more red.

I don't think so. That star is pretty red there, pretty much the lowest frequency visible to the human eye. Even a "red" star will emit tons of colors aside from red. For example, our sun is a yellow sun, but it really only has a yellow tint.

As I understand it, if you reduce its light output off of something and compare it to a pure "white light," you would see it has a yellowish tint. If you look straight at the sun, it appears white. Similarly, a red star will have a red tint, but, if you looks straight at all but the dimmest stars up close, you will perceive a white star. So, because of the light ouptut limits of our screens, to make a realistic-looking star you need to start with a white star and slightly reduce the values of each color until you have a slight tint, not overwhelm our screens with bright neon red. Someone correct me if I'm wrong, though.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stellar_classification

There's a chart a little way down the page showing the actual apparent color of stars.

Thus your brown dwarf is a brown dwarf round a brown dwarf.

Thus your brown dwarf is a brown dwarf round a brown dwarf.

No. Volcaniosis (whatever it is) is a sub-brown dwarf with just 8 Jool masses (Brown dwarfs irl need 13 jupiter masses to be brown dwarfs, jool is basically jupiter).

And Serious is actually (I changed my mind) an L0-class star that fuses hydrogen. (Yes, there are a few L-dwarfs that fuse hydrogen and not deuterium)

I've started working on Ablate. Right now it's based of Dres and is a spiky hellhole with 6km high mountains.

The solar panel fixer only runs because it's told to run in RealSolarSystemSettings.cfg. If you remove the power curve, it won't run. That's true for anything RSS does: like I said, RSS only does things if you tell it to.
